headline.main: Cuomo's Health Chief: Innovation and Influence

byline.original: By JEFFREY SCHMALZ, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: How out of place David Axelrod seems in the halls of the State Capitol.
docs.snippet: LEAD: How out of place David Axelrod seems in the halls of the State Capitol.

headline.main: Health; Trip Across Adolescence Is Just as Risky as Ever

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Despite revolutionary progress in preventing and treating life-threatening infections through immunization and antibiotics, teen-agers today are as likely to get sick and die before reaching their 20's as they were in the 1940's and 1950's. Only the causes of death and disability have changed dramatically, shifting from traditional medical problems to health effects stemming more from social causes.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Despite revolutionary progress in preventing and treating life-threatening infections through immunization and antibiotics, teen-agers today are as likely to get sick and die before reaching their 20's as they were in the 1940's and 1950's....
